author: sky.cactus
content: In theory, a 1559 transaction could cost 0 gas, but that means that the network is totally uncongested.

author: sky.cactus
content:
> Assuming the minimum base fee under 1559 is 1 gwei, then a transaction could in theory be sent with a fee cap of 1, meaning 1 gwei burnt and 0 gwei to the miner, but a miner would have to accept it.
<@!552133098075193354> Last I checked the minimum was 0.  It can only reach this level if there is less absolute demand for blockspace than there is supply of block space for an extended period (something we haven't seen for quite a while in Ethereum).

author: abdel.stark
content: The current minimum for the base fee on EIP-1559 is 7 wei

author: sky.cactus
content: I thought we decided against an arbitrary limit in favor of a simplified base fee adjustment algorithm?

author: abdel.stark
content: Did we ? I don't remember about that. I mean the minimum value is implied by the algorithm. We are not setting it explicitly. If some parameters like the change denominator changes then the minimum value will change as well.

author: abdel.stark
content: BTW <@!301186049323958275> <@!273808422753796097> Is there any rationale behind the symmetry between increase and decrease for the change denominator ? i.e Would the security be affected if we had a different max change denominator on both sides. For example 1/8 on the increase side and 1/4 on the decrease side.

author: sky.cactus
content: Our fallable human brains desire symmetry.

author: abdel.stark
content: Ok. so no particular reason. If for any reason we have arguments to allow decreasing quicker that would be feasible, right ?

author: sky.cactus
content: It has been discussed in the past I think, just no strong compelling reason to do it.

author: sky.cactus
content: In fact, the entire formula for increasing/decreasing is incredibly arbitrary.

author: abdel.stark
content: Yep. This is also why we made the elasticity multiplier and the change denominator configurable in case we want to test multiple configurations to find the optimal numbers.

author: sky.cactus
content: I suspect "optimal" is incredibly fuzzy and only something we can really adjust in hindsight, and guessing about the future of Ethereum usage.

author: sky.cactus
content: And we have to be careful about curve fitting.
